data.title: What if Joanna I dies in 1506 instead of Philip?

data.text:
So we all know about Juana la loca, the middle child of Queen Isabell and King Ferdinand and her husband Philip and how Philip died in 1506 while Joanna lived and was effectively robbed of her crown. So what if it was Joanna who died in 1506 instead of Philip? Would Philip just go home, since he can't bring Charles to Castile or would he stay there? Who does he remarry in this scenario and how does Ferdinand II of Aragon react?

I think that, with the help of many Castilian nobles, who harboured a deep dislike for Felipe because of his Catalan origins, Philip could come to Spain regardless of the death of Juana, especially if she died after becoming Queen of Castille. This way, Philip would become King of Castile, or at least regent. In addition to the support of the anti-Catalan nobility in Castille, there were also powerful international factors that favoured closer relations between Austria and Spain, giving Phillip more support to stay in Spain.

a deep dislike for Felipe because of his Catalan origins

I think you mean Ferdinand. Plus Philip was in Castile when he died so in this timeline when Joanna dies he is the one left in Castile.

So Philip becomes King of Castile in his own right? I wonder how Ferdinand would react.

No, i imagine op means what if joanna dies, leaving castille to her son, Charles.

I personally think Charles would travel to Castille at that young age, meaning he would be more like Ferdinand, who was a Spaniard by culture. Perhaps Philip brings Ferdinand back to Flanders when he inevitably returns home, because no one is going to accept him as regent, switching the brothers around.
